snippet: The Hudson County Correctional Facility is the focus of a civil rights complaint brought by advocates, who cite dozens of cases of what they call subpar or even dangerous medical care for detainees.
abstract: Two citizens coalitions file civil rights complaint with Homeland Security Dept against Hudson County Correctional Facility in Kearny, NJ; filing describes 61 cases in which immigration detainees received substandard medical care; complaint urges department to either end its immigration detention contract with jail or appoint investigator to improve conditions.
lead_paragraph: The Hudson County Correctional Facility is the focus of a civil rights complaint brought by advocates, who cite dozens of cases of what they call subpar or even dangerous medical care for detainees.

headline.main: Health Care at New Jersey Immigrant Jail Is Substandard, Watchdog Groups Say
headline.print_headline: Watchdogs Call Health Care at New Jersey Immigrant Jail Substandard

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Community Initiatives for Visiting Immigrants in Confinement
